docs.title: This is my personal blog.
docs.text: I have always been wanting a personal blog. After a long while of pondering and picking what to use for my blog, I got tired of the reluctant, so I just picked whatever on my mind and go with it.

docs.title: Hibikiji
docs.text:
As a self-acclaimed weeaboo, I want to use the term Kiji (as Article, Writing,... in Japanese), but I also like the character Hibiki so I'll just combine it. Yes I know, very tasteless. And the fact that I acknowledge it does not mean it will be less tasteless.

I will be writing about a lot of things. And this blog is mainly for myself to look back after some time.

docs.title: What will I write?
docs.text: I don't know, many many things I think! From Technology studies to the places I have been, to my own thoughts on many things. I believe that by writing it will keep me sane. And I hope I won't get tired of it.

docs.title: Hands-on Kubernetes actions for Beginners
docs.text: This will contains source code and walkthrough to interact with kubernetes and learning its behaviors.

docs.title: Walkthrough:
docs.text:
• Setup a local k8s environment with Minikube
  • Inspect the service and the container image
  • Create a Namespace
  • Create a Deployment
  • Create a Service

docs.title: Setup a local Kubernetes environment with Minikube
0. Check if homebrew is installed
docs.text:
• Homebrew is a tool similar to apt-get, is used to install packages on your machines.
  • Runs this command to check if it was installed.
brew -v
  • If not, following this to install: https://brew.sh/
/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
  • Relauch terminal and Re-run brew -v to check if it was installed successfully.

docs.title: 1. Install Docker container or similar environment:
docs.text:
We will install OrbStack to our Mac machine. Following https://docs.orbstack.dev/quick-start

brew install orbstack

docs.title: 2. Install minikube
docs.text:
Following this to install minikube on your machine: https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/start/ - Runs this command

brew install minikube
  • Runs this to check for minikube command:
brew unlink minikube
brew link minikube

docs.title: 3. Start your clusters
docs.text:
• Start your cluster with this command to launch a kubernetes cluster with 3 nodes:
  • You can use this command to delete previously created kubernetes.
minikube delete
  • You can ignore --nodes=3 to lauch it with only 1 node.
minikube start --nodes=3
